html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font div table tbody tr td div span span
content: World Affairs correspondent, BBC News website

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td div div span
content: Iran said the suspension of nuclear activities was only temporary

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font b span
content: Iran's threat to restart the process of enriching uranium has kept the world guessing about its ultimate intentions and has put its opponents on the back foot again.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Its obfuscation is in keeping with its past tactics.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The one thing Iran has not offered in this whole saga is clarity.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Yet without clarity, nobody knows how to respond - not the US, nor the European countries negotiating, with grudging US support, with Iran - Britain, France and Germany - nor the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), nor the Russians nor the Chinese, let alone the UN.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The sophistication of the Iranian threat is shown in the limited steps it proposes to take.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: This would involve the conversion of crushed uranium ore (yellowcake), which it already has, into uranium hexafluoride, a gas that then has to be spun in centrifuges to separate the parts needed for nuclear power.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: It could argue that conversion is a "pre-enrichment" process.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: That argument has already been dismissed by the European Union Three (EU3) who say that under an agreement last November, Iran agreed to suspend all enrichment "activities" while holding talks about agreeing "objective guarantees" that its future nuclear power programme would be peaceful.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Quite why the threat has resurfaced at this moment is not clear. Nor is it clear why the threat was not carried out immediately.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: It could be that Iran thinks that its talks with the three European countries are getting nowhere and that this is a way of trying to get some progress.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: It might have wanted to test the waters to see what might happen next. There could even have been disagreements in the Iranian government itself.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td div div b span
content: Maybe they have decided to have the confrontation sooner rather than later. They might think they are strong enough anyway

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td div div span
content: Dr Samore, International Institute for Strategic Studies

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: It could also be that the Iranian presidential elections next month have something to do with it.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The previous president, the conservative though pragmatic Hashemi Rafsanjani, has announced that he is to stand and maybe the threat is part of manoeuvring connected to that.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: One theory is that uncertainty would be good for him as he is an experienced hand and Iranians might vote for experience.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: But nobody really knows and diplomacy is reduced to guesswork.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: "I thought the Iranians would wait until after the presidential elections, " said Dr Gary Samore of the International Institute for Strategic Studies (IISS) in London.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: "But maybe they have decided to have the confrontation sooner rather than later. They might think they are strong enough anyway. Alternatively, they might resume activities now only to suspend them again later."

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The only clarity has come from the EU3, supported by the United States. They have said that if Iran does resume enrichment, then a special meeting of the IAEA governors will be called with the intention of reporting Iran to the Security Council for violating the Nuclear non-Proliferation Treaty in the past.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font table tbody tr td div div span
content: Tehran insists its nuclear programme is entirely peaceful

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: If the Security Council orders Iran to stop enrichment and it does not, then it could face sanctions.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: These could include an arms embargo, a ban on nuclear co-operation and restrictions on investment in oil and gas development.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: But it is a big if, given that Russia and China would have to agree.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Russia is itself involved in completing a nuclear power station in Iran and China buys a great deal of oil from Iran.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The risk is that Iran is simply acting tactically and that strategically it still intends to master the technology of the full enrichment cycle.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: If that is the case, it will have to declare its hand at some stage and face the consequences. Ultimately these could go beyond UN sanctions and could involve a threat by Israel to attack Iran's nuclear facilities.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p b span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: Iran argues that under the NPT, a country wanting to develop nuclear power - and that is all it wants to do, it claims - is allowed to enrich its own fuel.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: This is true, but Iran's problem is that the IAEA has established that it hid an enrichment programme for nearly 20 years.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: The US and the EU3 now argue that it cannot be trusted and must therefore not be allowed to enrich.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: In their view the only effective "objective guarantee" would be to have no enrichment at all.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: They reject the increased inspections that Iran is offering as inadequate.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td font p span
content: This is because the same technology used to enrich uranium to a level needed for nuclear power can also be used to enrich to a level needed for a nuclear bomb.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td p font span
content: If Iran were allowed to develop an enrichment cycle, it would be able to use the technology to make a nuclear bomb in due course, at a time of its own choosing.
